The loop invariant for the i-th iteration of the `give_count` loop is:

`count_value_i = count_value + arr[i]`

where `count_value_i` represents the value of `count_value` at the beginning of the i-th iteration and `arr[i]` represents the value of the i-th element in the array `arr`.

The invariant ensures that each iteration increases the count of elements in the array equal to the target value, thus proving the partial correctness of the `give_count` function.

The loop invariant for the `give_count` loop is:

`count_value_i = count_value + 1`

where `count_value_i` represents the value of `count_value` at the beginning of the i-th iteration and `i` represents the current index in the array `arr`.

This invariant ensures that the count of elements in the array equal to the target value is incremented each iteration, proving the correctness of the `give_count` function.
